companyManual.content:
Sécurité Services Plus (SS+), founded in 2002, is a Tunisian-based company specialising in comprehensive fire safety equipment and workplace safety solutions with over 23 years of experience. Headquartered in Sfax with a significant branch in Tunis, the company provides nationwide coverage for businesses of all sizes, offering products ranging from fire extinguishers and detection systems to personal protective equipment (PPE) and industrial workwear. The organization is structured as a SARL and is led by Managers Karim Ben Salem and Najla Ben Salem, who oversee strategy, sales, and purchasing.


**Core Products and Technical Services**

SS+ offers a wide array of safety solutions designed to meet international and local standards:
Fire Safety Equipment: The company sells, installs, and maintains various fire extinguishers (Powder, CO2, Foam, Water, Clean Agent) from 1kg to over 50kg, providing certificates of installation and compliance documentation. They also manage fire hose reel systems, fire detection and alarm systems, and emergency lighting.
Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): Their inventory includes head, eye, face, hand, respiratory, hearing, fall, and foot protection.
Workwear and Uniforms: SS+ provides industrial workwear, including flame-resistant coveralls and high-visibility clothing, and offers custom branding services such as embroidery and screen printing.
Safety Signage and First Aid: They produce and install various safety signs (emergency exit, warning, mandatory) using materials like PVC and photoluminescent aluminium, alongside supplying first aid kits and emergency showers.


**Operational Standards and Service Commitments**

The company differentiates itself through strict service standards and modern technology:
Response Times: SS+ commits to answering phone calls within three rings, responding to email inquiries within four hours, and delivering quotations within one business day. Emergency services are addressed within 24 hours.
Quality Assurance: Technicians are highly trained, and all service work is backed by a 06-month warranty. Quality is further managed through a technician self-inspection checklist and random spot-checks by Team Leaders.
Digital Integration: The company utilizes the WAVE PLUS web application, allowing customers to track service history, certificates, and renewals through an online portal.


**Governance and Decision-Making Authority**

The manual outlines a clear Authority Matrix to ensure efficient and controlled operations:
Strategic Decisions: Only the Managers can approve major capital investments, legal matters over 10,000 TND, or discounts exceeding 20%.
Financial Approval Limits: Spending authority is tiered by position; for example, Operations Responsibles can approve up to 1,000 TND, Team Leaders up to 500 TND, and Technicians up to 100 TND.
Signature Authority: Contracts and bank transactions over 5,000 TND generally require two signatures from the management team.


**Commercial and Financial Policies**

SS+ employs structured pricing and credit policies to manage business risk and customer relations:
Pricing and Discounts: Fire equipment typically has a standard markup of 35%. Sales Representatives have the authority to grant discounts up to 15%, while the Sales Responsible can approve up to 20%.
Payment Terms: While new customers typically operate on a cash-on-delivery or 50% deposit basis, established and loyal customers may be granted terms of 30, 60, or 90 days.
Travel Fees: Travel is free within 120 km of the Sfax or Tunis facilities; beyond this, tiered fees apply (e.g., 150 TND for 121–200 km) unless waived for large orders or contract customers.
Risk Management: The company proactively declines business involving high credit risk, litigious reputations, or technical requirements that exceed their expertise or safety standards.


**Ethics and Complaint Handling**

The company maintains high ethical standards, strictly prohibiting conflicts of interest and the acceptance of expensive gifts over 100 TND. Their complaint handling process is rigorous, requiring acknowledgment within four hours and aiming for investigation and resolution within 24 to 72 hours. If SS+ is at fault for a service error, they provide free rework or correction immediately. All employees must acknowledge receipt and understanding of this manual to ensure alignment with company values and operational rules.

hoseReel.title: FIRE HOSE REEL SERVICES
hoseReel.intro: Fire hose reels are installed in buildings to allow occupants or trained personnel to fight small fires before the fire brigade arrives.

components.title: A. COMPONENTS OF A FIRE HOSE REEL

items.inlet: Inlet Connection: Fixed piping connection (typically ¾" or 1" threaded).
items.reel: Reel Drum: Holds the hose; can be manual or automatic rewind.
items.hose: Hose: Usually 25m or 30m length; made of rubber or synthetic material.
items.nozzle: Nozzle: Adjustable spray/jet nozzle for controlling water flow.
items.valve: Shut-off Valve: Ball valve or gate valve to control water supply.
items.cabinet: Cabinet/Housing: Protective enclosure mounted on wall.
items.signage: Signage & Labels: Required identification and instructions.

inspection.title: B. SEMI-ANNUAL & ANNUAL INSPECTION
inspection.intro: Inspections are similar to fire extinguisher protocols, checking accessibility, visibility, and operational readiness.

items.signage: Signage clearly visible and not blocked.
items.cabinet: Cabinet/housing in good condition (no rust or damage).
items.hose: Hose is fully wound and free of cracks, cuts, or dry rot.
items.nozzle: Nozzle is attached and not damaged.
items.pressure: Water pressure test (flow test for annual inspection).
items.label: Test label or tag attached with date and technician ID.

procedure.title: Procedure
procedure.visual: Visual inspection: Check hose reel is accessible, signage clear, and components intact.
procedure.unwind: Unwind 2–3 meters of hose to check for damage and smooth operation.
procedure.valve: Open and close shut-off valve to ensure it operates correctly.
procedure.flow: Water flow test (annual or if requested): Turn on water and check nozzle function and pressure.
procedure.rewind: Rewind hose onto reel to ensure mechanism works properly.
procedure.record: Record findings and attach inspection tag.

hoseDamage.title: Hose Damage

hoseDamage.action: Replace hose section or entire hose.

fireBlanket.title: FIRE BLANKET INSPECTION
fireBlanket.intro: Fire blankets are passive fire safety devices used to smother small fires, particularly grease or clothing fires, or to wrap around a person whose clothes are on fire.

items.material: Typically made of woven fiberglass or treated wool.
items.packaging: Stored in a wall-mounted container with pull tabs for quick deployment.
items.compliance: Must meet local fire safety standards (e.g., EN 1869 in Europe).

inspection.title: B. INSPECTION CHECKLIST
inspection.intro: Fire blanket inspections are quick visual checks, usually performed during fire extinguisher inspections.

items.signage: Signage is visible and indicates "FIRE BLANKET."
items.container: Container is intact, properly mounted, and accessible.
items.seal: Seal or safety tab (if present) is unbroken.
items.tabs: Pull tabs are visible and easy to access.
items.damage: No visible damage to the container or blanket (if visible through packaging).
items.expiry: Expiry date or manufacturing date is checked (blankets have a service life, typically 7 years).

note.title: Note on Deployment
note.content: Once a fire blanket has been used or unpackaged, it must be replaced. Fire blankets are single-use items and cannot be re-certified or refilled.

overview.title: A. OVERVIEW
overview.intro: SS+ provides sales, installation, and testing services for smoke detectors, which are critical components of fire alarm systems.

types.title: Types of Smoke Detectors
types.ionization: Ionization Smoke Detectors: Detect fast-flaming fires.
types.photoelectric: Photoelectric Smoke Detectors: Detect slow-smoldering fires.
types.dual: Dual-Sensor Detectors: Combine both technologies for comprehensive detection.

items.location: Detector is mounted in the correct location (ceiling or high on wall).
items.power: Power indicator light is functioning (for hardwired units).
items.test: Test button pressed to verify alarm sounds.
items.dust: Detector is free of dust, cobwebs, or obstructions.
items.sensitivity: Sensitivity test (using smoke or aerosol test spray).
items.label: Test label attached with date and technician ID.

procedure.title: Procedure
procedure.visual: Visual inspection: Check mounting, cleanliness, and indicator light.
procedure.testButton: Press test button: Alarm should sound within 3–5 seconds.
procedure.sensitivityTest: Sensitivity test (annual or if required): Use smoke or aerosol test spray to ensure detector responds to smoke.
procedure.batteryCheck: Battery check: Replace battery if low or if unit is more than 1 year old (for battery units).
procedure.record: Record findings and attach inspection label.

items.cleaning: Cleaning: Remove dust with vacuum or soft cloth; avoid water or chemicals.
items.battery: Battery Replacement: Annually or as needed.
items.replacement: Full Detector Replacement: Every 10 years (or per manufacturer's recommendation), as sensors degrade over time.
items.malfunction: Malfunctioning Detector: Replace immediately if test fails or unit chirps indicating low battery.

fireAlarm.title: FIRE ALARM SYSTEM SERVICES
fireAlarm.intro: SS+ offers basic fire alarm system inspection and testing services. However, comprehensive fire alarm system installation, programming, and certification require specialized expertise and certifications beyond SS+'s current scope.

preparation.title: A. PREPARATION BEFORE SERVICE
preparation.notify: Notify facility management or security 24–48 hours before testing to prevent false alarms.
preparation.coordinate: Coordinate with the fire alarm monitoring company (if system is monitored).
preparation.shutdown: If required, arrange for temporary alarm shutdown during testing.

items.visual: Visual inspection of control panel, detectors, manual call points, and sounders.
items.test: Functionality test of smoke detectors, heat detectors, and manual call points.
items.alarm: Alarm activation test (to verify sounders and visual alarms work).
items.record: Record findings and issue a basic service report.

procedure.title: Testing Procedure
procedure.panel: Check control panel: Verify power indicator, fault indicators, and zone status.
procedure.detectors: Test detectors: Use smoke or heat test equipment to activate detectors.
procedure.callPoints: Test manual call points: Activate each call point using a test key.
procedure.sounders: Verify sounders and strobes: Ensure alarm bells, horns, or strobes activate during test.
procedure.batteryTest: Battery backup test: Disconnect main power; verify system runs on battery backup.
procedure.reset: Reset system: Clear alarms and return system to normal operation.
procedure.report: Complete service report and notify customer of any faults or recommendations.

items.faultyDetector: Faulty detector: Does not activate during smoke/heat test.
items.damagedCallPoint: Damaged or broken manual call point.
items.panelFault: Control panel fault indicator or zone trouble.

limitations.title: D. LIMITATIONS OF SS+ BASIC SERVICE

items.installation: Full fire alarm system installation (requires certified fire alarm technician).
items.programming: System programming or reprogramming of control panels.
items.certification: Certification or compliance documentation (requires accredited third-party inspector).
items.integration: Integration with building management systems (BMS) or advanced addressable systems.
items.design: Design or engineering of fire alarm systems.

limitations.note: For full fire alarm system installation or certification, SS+ can refer customers to certified specialists or partner companies.

vehicleStock.title: STANDARD VEHICLE STOCK LIST
vehicleStock.intro: Each SS+ service vehicle must carry a minimum stock of materials and spare parts to complete most service jobs without returning to the workshop.

water.label: Water
water.desc: Deionized or distilled for water ext.

items.visual: Visual inspection of stock at the end of each week.
items.count: Count remaining powder, CO2, foam, and key spare parts.
items.report: Report low stock to Team Leader if below minimum trigger.

minimum.title: Minimum Stock Triggers
minimum.powder: ABC Powder: Below 15kg remaining → request refill.
minimum.co2: CO2: Less than 5kg in portable cylinder → refill or replace.
minimum.spares: Spare Parts: If any critical part (gauges, pins, seals) is down to last 2 units → restock.

workshopInventory.title: WORKSHOP INVENTORY
workshopInventory.intro: The Sfax and Tunis workshops maintain a larger inventory to refill service vehicles and handle workshop-based repairs and refilling.

items.powder40: ABC Powder (40% Grade): Minimum 500kg in stock (Sfax); 200kg (Tunis).
items.powder30: ABC Powder (30% or 60% Grade): 100kg minimum (Sfax only).
items.co2Bulk: CO2 (Bulk): Large cylinders or tank storage (Sfax); small cylinders (Tunis).
items.nitrogen: Nitrogen Gas: Large cylinders for pressurization.
items.water: Deionized/Distilled Water: For water extinguisher refilling.

items.seals: Seals, O-Rings, Gaskets: Assorted sizes (100+ pieces).

storage.title: C. STORAGE CONDITIONS
storage.powder: ABC Powder: Store in sealed drums in dry area; avoid moisture.
storage.co2: CO2 Cylinders: Store upright in well-ventilated area; secure to prevent tipping.
storage.foam: Foam Concentrate: Store in original containers; check expiry dates.
storage.nitrogen: Nitrogen Gas: Store in secure, ventilated area; clearly labeled.
storage.spareParts: Spare Parts: Organized by type in labeled bins or shelves.
storage.temperature: Temperature Control: Avoid extreme heat or cold (ideal: 15–30°C).

stockUsage.title: RECORDING STOCK USAGE
stockUsage.intro: Accurate tracking of stock usage is essential for inventory management, billing accuracy, and preventing shortages.

appLog.title: 1. Log in WAVE PLUS App
appLog.intro: For each service completed, technicians must record materials used in the WAVE PLUS Mobile App:

items.powder: Powder refill: Record weight used (e.g., "6kg ABC Powder").
items.co2: CO2 refill: Record weight or cylinder size (e.g., "2kg CO2").
items.foam: Foam refill: Record volume (e.g., "9L Foam Concentrate").
items.spareParts: Spare parts: Record parts replaced (e.g., "1 Pressure Gauge, 1 Safety Pin").

dailyReport.title: 2. End-of-Day Summary
dailyReport.intro: At the end of each day, the technician submits a summary report in the app:

workshop.title: B. WORKSHOP STOCK USAGE
workshop.intro: Workshop-based refilling or repairs are logged similarly:

items.workOrder: Work order number linked to each job.
items.materials: Materials used (powder, CO2, foam, spare parts).
items.technician: Technician ID who performed the work.

workshop.note: The Operations Responsible or Workshop Manager reviews weekly usage reports to identify trends, shortages, or discrepancies.

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.content: Technician reports low stock (below minimum trigger) OR at the end of a busy week.

process.title: Process
process.request: Technician submits restock request via WAVE PLUS or verbally to Team Leader.
process.approval: Team Leader reviews request and approves.
process.pickup: Technician visits workshop (Sfax or Tunis) to pick up materials.
process.record: Workshop logs materials issued to vehicle (recorded in WAVE PLUS or inventory log).
process.update: Technician updates vehicle stock levels in WAVE PLUS.

timing.title: Timing
timing.content: Restocking should occur at the start of the week (Monday morning) or mid-week if needed.

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.content: Workshop inventory falls below reorder point (e.g., ABC Powder below 200kg in Sfax).

process.title: Process
process.request: Workshop Manager or Operations Responsible submits purchase request to Purchasing (Najla BEN SALEM).
process.approval: Purchasing approves and places order with supplier.
process.inspection: Workshop Manager inspects delivery for quality and quantity.
process.log: Log new stock in inventory system (WAVE PLUS or spreadsheet).

vendors.title: Preferred Vendors
vendors.intro: SS+ has established relationships with suppliers for:

items.spareParts: Spare Parts: Multiple vendors (priority: quality and lead time)

items.inspection: Incoming Inspection: All materials inspected upon delivery for damage, expiry dates, and compliance with specifications.
items.testing: Batch Testing: Random testing of powder purity, foam concentrate effectiveness, and CO2 purity (if equipment available).
items.reject: Reject Non-Conforming Materials: Any substandard materials are rejected and returned to supplier.

items.labeling: Labeling: All materials clearly labeled with product name, grade, batch number, and expiry date.
items.fifo: FIFO (First-In, First-Out): Use oldest stock first to prevent expiry or degradation.
items.segregation: Segregation: Store incompatible materials separately (e.g., powder away from moisture; CO2 away from heat sources).
items.security: Security: Restrict access to inventory areas to authorized personnel only.
items.cleanup: Cleanliness: Keep storage areas clean, dry, and free of pests.

equipmentTools.title: REQUIRED EQUIPMENT & TOOLS
equipmentTools.intro: Beyond materials and spare parts, each service vehicle must carry the necessary equipment and tools to perform inspections, refilling, and basic repairs.

items.screwdrivers: Screwdriver Set: Flat-head and Phillips (multiple sizes).
items.pliers: Pliers: Standard, needle-nose, and locking pliers.
items.valveKey: Valve Removal Tool: For removing valve assemblies from extinguisher bodies.
items.torqueWrench: Torque Wrench: For proper tightening of valve assemblies (critical for safety).
items.hammerMallet: Hammer & Rubber Mallet: For loosening stuck parts.
items.wireTools: Wire Cutters & Strippers: For safety pins and tamper seals.
items.measureTape: Measuring Tape: For mounting height verification.
items.bubbleLevel: Bubble Level: Ensure proper extinguisher mounting.

items.fillingEquip: Powder Filling Equipment: Portable powder filling adapter and funnel.
items.co2Hose: CO2 Filling Hose: With appropriate fittings for CO2 cylinders.
items.pressureGauge: Pressure Gauge (Calibrated): For verifying pressure during refilling.
items.weightScale: Weight Scale: For weighing CO2 extinguishers before and after refilling.
items.hydrotestPump: Hydrostatic Test Pump (Optional): For 10-year pressure tests (may be workshop-only).
items.leakDetector: Leak Detection Fluid: Soapy water or specialized leak detection spray.
items.vacuumPump: Vacuum Pump (Optional): For evacuating air from CO2 cylinders before refilling.

items.gloves: Safety Gloves: Chemical-resistant gloves for handling powder and foam.
items.safetyGlasses: Safety Glasses or Goggles: Eye protection during refilling.
items.mask: Dust Mask or Respirator: For protection against powder inhalation.
items.apron: Apron or Coveralls: Protect clothing from powder and chemicals.
items.steelToes: Steel-Toed Boots: Required for all technicians.
items.firstAid: First Aid Kit: Basic first aid supplies in vehicle.

items.rags: Cleaning Rags & Towels: Wipe extinguishers and clean up spills.
items.brushes: Brushes: For cleaning valve threads and nozzles.
items.solvent: Solvent or Degreaser: For removing stubborn dirt or grease.
items.lubricant: Lubricant (Silicone or Grease): For valve assemblies and moving parts.
items.vacuum: Portable Vacuum (Optional): For cleaning powder spills in vehicle or workshop.

items.tablet: Tablet or Smartphone: Pre-loaded with WAVE PLUS Mobile App.
items.serviceForms: Service Report Forms: Paper backup forms (in case of app failure).
items.inspectionTags: Inspection Tags & Labels: Pre-printed with company logo and space for date/technician ID.
items.camera: Camera: For photo documentation (most smartphones sufficient).
items.invoiceBook: Invoice Book or Receipt Pad: For cash payments or immediate invoicing.

ladderAccess.title: LADDER & ACCESS EQUIPMENT
ladderAccess.intro: Fire extinguishers and other fire safety equipment are often mounted at heights requiring ladders or access equipment.

items.step: Step Ladder: 2-meter or 3-meter step ladder for most indoor work.
items.extension: Extension Ladder: 4-meter to 6-meter extension ladder for high-ceiling or outdoor installations.
items.safety: Ladder Safety: All ladders must meet safety standards (e.g., EN 131); regular inspection for damage.
items.securing: Ladder Securing: Use ladder stabilizers or have a second person hold the ladder for safety.

items.harness: Safety Harness: Required for work above 2 meters (if no guardrails or scaffolding).
items.training: Training: Technicians must be trained in working at height and ladder safety.
items.inspection: Ladder Inspection: Before each use, inspect ladder for cracks, bent rungs, or loose fittings.

purpose.title: WHY DOCUMENTATION MATTERS
purpose.intro: Service documentation is not just a formality—it is a critical business practice that protects SS+, ensures quality, and builds customer trust.

legalProtection.title: 1. Legal Protection
legalProtection.description: Service records prove that SS+ fulfilled its obligations if a customer claims poor service or if an accident occurs. Proper documentation shows due diligence and compliance with safety standards.

qualityControl.title: 2. Quality Control
qualityControl.description: Documentation allows Team Leaders and management to review technician work, identify errors, and provide coaching or corrective action.

transparency.title: 3. Customer Transparency
transparency.description: Customers receive clear records of what was done, what materials were used, and what is recommended for future service—building trust and professionalism.

serviceHistory.title: 4. Service History & Continuity
serviceHistory.description: Future technicians can review past service reports to understand equipment history, recurring issues, and customer preferences.

billingAccuracy.title: 5. Billing Accuracy
billingAccuracy.description: Accurate documentation of materials used and time spent ensures correct invoicing and prevents disputes.

improvement.title: 6. Continuous Improvement
improvement.description: Analysis of service data (e.g., common faults, time per service, material usage) helps SS+ improve processes and training.

coreRequirements.title: CORE DOCUMENTATION REQUIREMENTS
coreRequirements.intro: Every service performed by SS+ must include the following documentation:

workOrder.title: Work Order
workOrder.description: Created before service begins; contains customer details, service scope, scheduled date/time, and assigned technician. Signed by customer upon service completion.

serviceReport.title: Service Report
serviceReport.description: Detailed record for EACH piece of equipment serviced, including: Equipment ID, Location, Type and size, Service performed, Findings (pass/fail, issues found), Materials used, Time spent. Technician signature and date.

inspectionChecklist.title: Inspection Checklist
inspectionChecklist.description: Pre-printed or digital checklist for each type of equipment (e.g., fire extinguisher, hose reel, smoke detector). Used to ensure all inspection points are covered.

customerSignOff.title: Customer Sign-Off Form
customerSignOff.description: Customer (or authorized representative) signs to confirm: Service was completed, Equipment is operational, Customer received copy of service report. If customer refuses to sign, technician notes reason and takes photo of completed work.

photos.title: Photos
photos.description: BEFORE photos: Show condition of equipment before service (especially if defects or damage found). AFTER photos: Show completed work, new tags, and equipment in service. Photos are uploaded to WAVE PLUS and linked to the work order.

materialsLog.title: Materials Usage Log
materialsLog.description: Record of ALL materials used (powder, CO2, foam, spare parts). Linked to work order for billing and inventory tracking.

items.complex: For complex projects or installations: Detailed project plan, Technical drawings or diagrams, Certificate of installation, Compliance documentation (e.g., proof of meeting fire code).
items.nonConformance: For non-conformance or incidents: Non-conformance report (NCR) if equipment fails inspection or is unsafe, Incident report if accident or injury occurs during service.

wavePlusApp.title: USING WAVE PLUS MOBILE APP FOR DOCUMENTATION
wavePlusApp.intro: SS+ uses the WAVE PLUS Mobile App as the primary tool for digital service documentation. The app streamlines data entry, photo uploads, and customer sign-off.

step1.title: ACCESS WORK ORDER
step1.content: Technician opens WAVE PLUS app, navigates to Schedule or My Work Orders, and selects the assigned work order. Reviews customer details, equipment list, and any previous service notes.

step2.title: START SERVICE
step2.content: Technician taps Start Service button to record start time. GPS location is captured (verifies technician is on-site).

step3.title: PERFORM SERVICE & COMPLETE CHECKLIST
step3.content: For each piece of equipment: Scan QR code or enter equipment ID manually, Complete inspection checklist (the app guides the technician through each step), Record findings (pass/fail, notes on defects or issues), Take BEFORE and AFTER photos (uploaded directly in the app).

step4.title: RECORD MATERIALS USED
step4.content: Technician enters materials used for each equipment: Powder refill: weight (e.g., 6kg ABC Powder), CO2 refill: weight (e.g., 2kg CO2), Spare parts: select from dropdown (e.g., Pressure Gauge, Safety Pin). App automatically calculates material cost and updates inventory.

step5.title: COMPLETE SERVICE REPORT
step5.content: Technician reviews service summary (auto-generated by app), Adds any additional notes or recommendations (e.g., "Replace extinguisher in 2 years," "Customer requested quote for new hose reel").

step6.title: CUSTOMER SIGN-OFF
step6.content: Technician presents tablet/phone to customer or authorized representative. Customer reviews service report and signs directly on the app (digital signature). If customer refuses to sign, technician notes reason in the app.

step7.title: SUBMIT & SYNC
step7.content: Technician taps End Service and Submit. App records end time and calculates total service duration. Data syncs to WAVE PLUS server (cloud-based). Customer receives email with PDF copy of service report (automatic).

items.faster: Faster data entry (pre-filled fields, dropdowns, and checklists).
items.errors: Reduced errors (app validates data and prevents missing information).
items.paperwork: Less paperwork (no need to carry paper forms or manually write reports).

items.immediate: Immediate access to service reports via email.
items.history: Online portal to view service history, certificates, and upcoming renewals.

items.centralized: Centralized data storage (all records in one cloud-based system).
items.realtime: Real-time visibility into technician activity and service progress.
items.analytics: Data analytics (e.g., average service time, common issues, material usage trends).

photoStandards.title: PHOTO DOCUMENTATION STANDARDS
photoStandards.intro: Photos are a critical part of service documentation. They provide visual proof of work performed and protect SS+ in case of disputes.

items.before: BEFORE Service: Condition of equipment before service (especially if damaged, corroded, or expired). Location of equipment (for installation or re-installation verification).
items.during: DURING Service: Complex repairs or component replacement (to document process). Any unusual findings or safety hazards.
items.after: AFTER Service: Completed work (e.g., newly installed extinguisher, refilled equipment). New inspection tags or labels attached. Final condition of equipment.

howToShoot.title: B. HOW TO TAKE GOOD SERVICE PHOTOS

items.clear: Clear & Focused: Ensure photo is in focus and well-lit (avoid blurry or dark images).
items.context: Show Context: Include enough of the surrounding area to show location (e.g., door number, wall-mounted extinguisher in hallway).
items.closeUp: Close-Ups: For tags, labels, gauges, or defects, take a close-up shot so details are readable.
items.multiple: Multiple Angles: For installations or complex work, take photos from different angles.
items.avoid: Avoid Clutter: Remove unnecessary objects from the frame; focus on the equipment or work area.

items.people: Avoid photographing people (unless necessary for safety documentation).
items.confidential: Do not photograph confidential or sensitive areas (e.g., server rooms, security systems) without customer permission.
items.consent: If customer objects to photos, note this in the service report and explain that photos are for quality and safety documentation.

customerSignOff.title: CUSTOMER SIGN-OFF PROCEDURES
customerSignOff.intro: Customer sign-off is the final step of service delivery. It confirms that the customer is satisfied with the work and that SS+ has fulfilled its obligations.

steps.present: Present Service Report: Technician reviews the service report with the customer, explaining what was done, any issues found, and recommendations.
steps.answer: Answer Questions: Customer may ask questions or request clarification; technician should answer clearly and professionally.
steps.signature: Obtain Signature: Customer signs the service report (digital signature on WAVE PLUS app or paper form if app is unavailable). Signature confirms: Service was completed to customer's satisfaction, Equipment is operational, Customer received a copy of the service report.

refusal.title: B. IF CUSTOMER REFUSES TO SIGN

items.reason: Ask Why: Politely ask the customer why they are refusing to sign. Common reasons: Dissatisfied with work quality, Dispute over billing or scope of work, Authorized representative not available.
items.resolve: Attempt to Resolve: If the issue is minor (e.g., customer wants additional work or clarification), attempt to resolve on the spot. If the issue is major (e.g., customer claims work was not done), contact Team Leader or Operations Responsible immediately.
items.document: Document Refusal: If customer still refuses to sign, technician notes the reason in the WAVE PLUS app (or on paper form). Take photos of completed work as proof. Technician signs the report stating "Customer refused to sign; reason: [state reason]."
items.followUp: Follow-Up: Team Leader or Sales Responsible follows up with customer within 24 hours to resolve the issue.

submission.title: DOCUMENT SUBMISSION & DEADLINES
submission.intro: Timely submission of service documentation is critical for billing, customer communication, and quality control.

sameDayRequirements.title: A. SAME-DAY REQUIREMENTS (END OF DAY BY 17:00)

step1.title: SYNC WAVE PLUS DATA
step1.description: All service reports completed that day must be synced to the server by 17:00.

step2.title: UPLOAD PHOTOS
step2.description: All photos must be uploaded and linked to the correct work orders.

step3.title: SUBMIT MATERIALS USAGE LOG
step3.description: Daily materials usage summary submitted (for inventory tracking).

step4.title: REPORT ISSUES OR NON-CONFORMANCES
step4.description: Any major issues, customer complaints, or safety hazards reported to Team Leader immediately (do not wait until end of day).

consequences.title: B. CONSEQUENCES OF LATE SUBMISSION

items.billing: Delayed billing: Invoices cannot be generated until service reports are submitted.
items.customer: Customer dissatisfaction: Customers expect prompt service reports and certificates.
items.data: Lost data: Risk of data loss if not synced to server (e.g., phone lost or app crashes).
items.quality: Quality control issues: Team Leaders cannot review work and provide timely feedback.

consequences.note: Repeated late submissions may result in disciplinary action (verbal warning, written warning, or suspension).

zoneMapping.title: WORKSHOP ZONE MAPPING (SFAX)
zoneMapping.intro: The Sfax workshop is organized into functional zones to optimize workflow and safety.

zone1.title: RECEIVING
zone1.description: Equipment drop-off, initial inspection, triage, and work order creation.

zone2.title: REFILLING
zone2.description: Powder, CO2, & Foam filling stations. High-ventilation zone.

zone3.title: REPAIR & ASSEMBLY
zone3.description: Valve replacement, part installation, and basic repairs.

zone4.title: DISPATCH & QC
zone4.description: Final inspection, labeling, and preparation for delivery/pickup.

zone5.title: STORAGE
zone5.description: Inventory, spare parts, and finished equipment awaiting delivery.

items.ppe: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): All workshop personnel must wear: Safety glasses or goggles, Steel-toed boots, Dust mask or respirator when handling powder, Chemical-resistant gloves when handling foam or CO2.
items.smoking: No Smoking: Smoking is strictly prohibited in the workshop and storage areas.
items.ventilation: Ventilation: Ensure adequate vent ilation when filling or handling chemicals (especially powder and foam).
items.fireExt: Fire Extinguishers: Fire extinguishers must be readily accessible in the workshop (ironic but essential!).
items.firstAid: First Aid: First aid kit and eyewash station available; all staff trained in basic first aid.
items.emergency: Emergency Exits: Keep emergency exits clear and marked.

items.co2: CO2 Handling: CO2 cylinders must be stored upright and secured to prevent tipping. Ensure good ventilation when filling CO2 to prevent asphyxiation. Never store CO2 in confined spaces.
items.pressure: Pressure Testing: Hydrostatic testing must be performed in a designated safety area with protective barriers. Only trained technicians may operate pressure testing equipment.
items.powder: Powder Handling: ABC powder is non-toxic but can cause respiratory irritation. Use dust masks when filling or handling powder. Clean up spills immediately to prevent slipping.
items.foam: Foam Concentrate Handling: Foam concentrate can be slippery and may cause skin irritation. Wear gloves and clean up spills immediately.

items.surfaces: Clean all work surfaces and wipe down equipment.
items.sweep: Sweep floors and dispose of waste properly.
items.tools: Return all tools to designated storage (see 5S below).
items.materials: Secure materials and chemicals in proper storage areas.
items.lights: Turn off lights and equipment (except those that must remain on).
items.check: Final safety check: Ensure no gas leaks, no open flames, and all exits clear.

chemicalStorage.title: CHEMICAL STORAGE & HANDLING
chemicalStorage.intro: Proper storage and handling of refilling agents (powder, CO2, foam, etc.) is critical for safety and product quality.

items.containers: Storage Containers: Store in sealed 50kg drums or bulk bags.
items.location: Location: Dry, well-ventilated area away from moisture and heat sources.
items.labeling: Labeling: Clearly labeled with product name, grade (e.g., 40% ABC Powder), batch number, and date received.
items.handling: Handling: Use funnel or powder filling adapter to minimize dust and spillage. Wear dust mask and gloves.

items.storage: Storage: Store CO2 cylinders upright in a well-ventilated area. Secure cylinders with chains or straps to prevent tipping.
items.temperature: Temperature: Avoid extreme heat (over 50°C) or direct sunlight.
items.warning: Warning Signs: Post "Compressed Gas" and "Asphyxiation Hazard" signs in storage area.
items.ventilation: Ventilation: Ensure adequate airflow to prevent CO2 accumulation (CO2 is heavier than air and can displace oxygen).

items.containers: Storage Containers: Store in original manufacturer's containers (typically 20L or 25L drums).
items.temperature: Temperature: Store in a cool, dry area  (avoid freezing or extreme heat).
items.expiry: Expiry Dates: Check expiry dates regularly; do not use expired foam concentrate.
items.spills: Spill Containment: Use secondary containment (e.g., plastic tray) to catch leaks or spills.

items.storage: Storage: Store nitrogen cylinders upright in a well-ventilated area (same precautions as CO2).
items.labeling: Labeling: Clearly labeled "Nitrogen Gas" to avoid confusion with CO2 or other gases.
items.handling: Handling: Use pressure regulators when filling extinguishers to control gas flow.

fiveS.title: 5S DISCIPLINE FOR WORKSHOP EFFICIENCY
fiveS.intro: SS+ follows the 5S methodology to maintain an organized, efficient, and safe workshop environment.

sort.title: 1. SORT (Seiri)
sort.definition: Remove unnecessary items from the workspace.

items.remove: Remove broken tools, obsolete parts, and clutter.
items.keep: Keep only the tools and materials needed for current work.
items.dispose: Dispose of waste properly; recycle if possible.

setInOrder.title: 2. SET IN ORDER (Seiton)
setInOrder.definition: Organize and label everything for easy access.

items.tools: Tools: Store in designated tool boards or cabinets (see Shadow Boards below).
items.parts: Spare Parts: Store in labeled bins or shelves.
items.materials: Materials: Store refilling agents in clearly marked areas.
items.labels: Labels: Use labels, color coding, or diagrams to indicate where items belong.

shine.title: 3. SHINE (Seiso)
shine.definition: Clean and inspect the workspace daily.

items.daily: Daily cleaning: Sweep floors, wipe surfaces, and remove dust.
items.equipment: Equipment maintenance: Clean and inspect tools and equipment.
items.spills: Spill cleanup: Immediately clean up any powder, foam, or chemical spills.

standardize.title: 4. STANDARDIZE (Seiketsu)
standardize.definition: Create consistent procedures and visual standards.

items.checklists: Use checklists for daily cleaning and safety checks.
items.procedures: Post standard operating procedures (SOPs) on walls or workstations.
items.visual: Use visual management (e.g., color-coded zones, shadow boards).

sustain.title: 5. SUSTAIN (Shitsuke)
sustain.definition: Maintain discipline and make 5S a habit.

items.training: Regular training and reminders for all workshop staff.
items.audits: Weekly 5S audits by Workshop Manager or Team Leader.
items.recognition: Recognize and reward teams or individuals who maintain high 5S standards.

shadowBoards.title: SHADOW BOARDS & TOOL ORGANIZATION
shadowBoards.intro: Shadow boards are visual tool management systems where each tool has a designated spot outlined on the board. If a tool is missing, the empty shadow is immediately visible.

items.efficiency: Faster tool retrieval (no searching for tools).
items.accountability: Immediate visibility if a tool is missing or misplaced.
items.maintenance: Encourages regular cleaning and maintenance of tools.

items.outline: Outline each tool with paint, tape, or labels.
items.label: Label each tool location (e.g., "12mm Wrench," "Screwdriver Set").
items.review: Review and update shadow boards as tools are added or removed.

maintenance.title: WORKSHOP EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE
maintenance.intro: Regular maintenance of workshop equipment ensures safety, accuracy, and efficiency.

daily.tasks: Clean work surfaces; Check nitrogen/CO2 pressure levels; Sweep floors; Empty waste bins.

weekly.tasks: Inspect powder filling equipment; Clean ventilation filters; Lubricate machinery; Inventory audit (spot-check parts and stock).

monthly.tasks: Calibrate pressure gauges (or as recommended by manufacturer); Inspect power tools and replace worn parts; Deep clean workshop (including storage areas); Check fire extinguisher(s) in workshop.

annual.tasks: Professional calibration of hydrostatic test equipment; Inspection and servicing of CO2 bulk tanks; Replacement of worn-out tools or equipment; Fire safety inspection of workshop facility.

items.hydrotest: Hydrostatic Test Pump: Must be calibrated annually; any malfunction requires immediate repair (safety-critical).
items.gauges: Pressure Gauges (Workshop): Calibrate monthly or per manufacturer's recommendation.
items.scales: Weighing Scales: Calibrate annually (required for accurate CO2 refilling).
items.ventilation: Ventilation System: Inspect and clean filters regularly; replace if airflow is reduced.

vehicleFleet.title: VEHICLE FLEET MAINTENANCE & REPLACEMENT
vehicleFleet.intro: SS+ service vehicles are critical assets. Proper maintenance and timely replacement ensure reliability and safety.

items.weekly: Weekly: Technicians check tire pressure, oil level, and fuel. Report any issues to Team Leader.
items.monthly: Monthly: Team Leader or designated person performs visual inspection (lights, brakes, bodywork).
items.quarterly: Quarterly: Professional service (oil change, filter replacement, brake inspection) at authorized garage.
items.annual: Annual: Comprehensive inspection and Tunisian vehicle safety check (Contrôle Technique).

replacement.title: B. VEHICLE REPLACEMENT CRITERIA
replacement.intro: Vehicles are considered for replacement when:

items.age: Age: Vehicle is older than 10 years.
items.mileage: Mileage: Vehicle has over 250,000 km (or as determined by management).
items.cost: Repair Costs: Annual repair costs exceed 30% of vehicle's current market value.
items.reliability: Reliability: Frequent breakdowns (more than 3 major breakdowns in a 6-month period).
items.safety: Safety: Vehicle fails safety inspection or has structural damage.

replacement.note: Managers (Karim & Najla) make final decision on vehicle replacement based on budget and operational needs.

regulatory.title: Regulatory Requirements
regulatory.semiAnnual: Semi-Annual Inspection (6 Months): Required by law; performed by certified in-house tech or approved provider (SS+).
regulatory.annual: Annual Inspection (12 Months): Must be performed by an approved service provider.
regulatory.fireDetection: Fire Detection Systems: Inspection every 3 months (Alarms, Smoke Detectors).

serviceOffering.title: Our Service Offering
serviceOffering.monthly: Monthly Visual Inspection: Customer self-service via WAVE PLUS portal.
serviceOffering.annualComprehensive: Annual Comprehensive: Detailed annual baseline/compliance inspection.

customerSelfService.title: Customer Monthly Visual Inspection (Self-Service)
customerSelfService.description: Customers with WAVE PLUS portal access can record monthly visual checks to maintain high safety standards between professional visits.

ssRole.title: SS+ Role in Self-Service
ssRole.description: We provide training, checklists, and monitor submissions. If issues are found, the customer contacts SS+ for standard or emergency service.

customerSelfService.benefits: Benefits: Early identification, reduced liability, and documented due diligence.

review.title: Review Data
review.description: Check WAVE PLUS for equipment list, history, and special requirements.

checkIn.title: Client Check-In
checkIn.description: Report to security; brief contact person on scope and timing.

setup.title: Set Up
setup.description: Wear PPE; prepare tablet/tools (flashlight, tags, pins).

items.cylinder: Cylinder: No damage, rust, or leaks

items.greenZone: Needle in GREEN zone (Fail if Red)

tagging.title: Tagging & Sync
tagging.description: Update physical service tag with Date, Technician ID, and Next Service Due. Synchronize all findings to WAVE PLUS including Equipment ID, Result status, and photographic evidence.

pass.description: Ready for use. Update tag and sync to WAVE PLUS.

minorIssue.description: Faded labels, minor rust. Note for next visit; remains in service.

fail.description: Pressure/damage issues. Red tag 'Out of Service'; inform client.

annualComprehensive.title: Annual Comprehensive Inspection
annualComprehensive.subtitle: Full baseline audit & compliance verification every 12 months
annualComprehensive.note: The Annual Inspection includes EVERYTHING in the Semi-Annual Inspection PLUS these critical mandatory procedures defined by Tunisian safety protocols:

internalExamination.title: Internal Examination
internalExamination.description: Mandatory for dry chemical powder types annually or if contamination is suspected.

hydrostaticCheck.title: Hydrostatic Check
hydrostaticCheck.description: Verify dates on all units (10yr first test, then 5yr cycles).

detailedWeighing.title: Detailed Weighing
detailedWeighing.description: Precision weight check for ALL units against nameplate specs.

items.identify: Identify slow leaks or agent loss
items.document: Document exact weights in WAVE PLUS

coverage.title: Coverage Adequacy
coverage.description: Distances within limits? New areas covered?

signage.title: Signage Complete
signage.description: Exit signs visible? Assembly points marked?

housekeeping.title: Housekeeping
housekeeping.description: Exits clear? No blockage of equipment?

completionMeeting.title: Annual Completion Meeting
completionMeeting.description: Beyond the inspection, the Annual visit serves as a strategic safety consultation:

items.presentReport: Present full written report (not verbal only)

refillingVsRecharging.title: Refilling vs. Recharging
refillingVsRecharging.refilling: Refilling: Replacing the extinguishing agent (powder, CO2, foam, water).
refillingVsRecharging.recharging: Recharging: Refilling + restoring correct operating pressure.

items.lowPressure: If pressure gauge shows low pressure.
items.maintenance: As part of scheduled maintenance (annual internal examination).
items.sealBroken: If seal broken for any reason.

serviceLocation.title: Service Location
serviceLocation.workshop: Workshop: Large quantities, complex work, better controlled environment.

safetyCritical.title: Safety Critical
safetyCritical.warning: These procedures must be followed exactly. Improper refilling can result in equipment failure in emergency or injury to technician.

generalSafety.title: General Safety Rules for Refilling Operations
generalSafety.subtitle: Before Starting ANY Refilling

items.stopIfDoubt: Stop if in doubt - ask Team Leader

abcPowder.title: ABC Powder Extinguisher Refilling
abcPowder.type: Type: Dry Chemical ABC Powder (Monoammonium Phosphate based)

verify.label: Verify
verify.description: Extinguisher type/size, capacity, condition (no damage), and hydrostatic test validity.

gather.label: Gather
gather.description: ABC powder (correct grade + 10%), O-rings, safety pin, tamper seal, inspection tag.
gather.tools: Tools: Wrenches, Funnel/Machine, Calibrated gauge/scale, Brush.

safety.label: Safety
safety.description: Glasses ON, Gloves ON, Dust mask ON. Area clean.

depressurize.title: Step 1: Depressurize
depressurize.critical: CRITICAL: Ensure gauge reads ZERO and hissing ceased. Position away from people.

prepare.title: Prepare
prepare.description: Position securely. If outdoors, check wind. Remove safety pin.

methodA.title: Method A (Controlled)
methodA.description: Loosen valve stem slowly. Listen for hissing.

methodB.title: Method B (Discharge)
methodB.description: Squeeze handle to discharge. Caution: Dust cloud - use mask.

items.lift: Lift out valve assembly with siphon tube.

items.stop: Stop when needle is centered in GREEN.

sealTag.title: Seal, Tag & QC

items.tag: Attach Service Tag (Date, Tech ID, Next Due).

sealTag.failWarning: If ANY check fails: CORRECT BEFORE RELEASE

wavePlus.title: Update WAVE PLUS
wavePlus.description: ID, Service Type (Refill), Materials (kg used), Pressure set, Next Due, Before/After Photos.

logs.title: Logs & Reports
logs.description: Record materials usage (powder, seals) in log. Generate Customer Report with signature.

coldBurn.title: Cold Burn Hazard
coldBurn.description: -78°C agent. Wear insulated gloves. Don't touch discharge horn.

asphyxiation.title: Asphyxiation
asphyxiation.description: Displaces oxygen. Work in well-ventilated area only.

highPressure.title: High Pressure
highPressure.description: ~60 bar stored. Handle cylinder with extreme care.

prepWeigh.title: Step 1: Prep & Weigh
prepWeigh.description: Weigh before opening. Discharge remaining gas slowly. Note Tare/Gross weights.

inspect.title: Step 2: Inspect
inspect.description: Check interior for corrosion/pitting. Critical for high pressure cylinders. Verify Test Date.

connect.title: Connect
connect.description: Use high-pressure filling hose to regulated CO2 source.

fill.title: Fill
fill.description: Fill slowly. Monitor precision scale continuously.

stabilize.title: Stabilize
stabilize.description: Stop at target. Let frost dissipate (5-10m). Re-weigh.

accuracy.title: Target Accuracy
accuracy.description: Must be within ±2% of rated weight. Never overfill (rupture risk).

items.weigh: Re-weigh full unit to verify charge.

items.waterFirst: Add WATER FIRST, then concentrate (Avoid foaming).
items.mix: Mix gently. Pour into cylinder slowly.

finalize.label: Finalize
finalize.value: Pressurize w/ Nitrogen (10-12 bar). NO AIR.

labeling.label: Labeling
labeling.value: Show Type, Conc %, Mix Date, Expiry (5yr).

advice.label: Advice
advice.value: Invert cylinder annually to mix solution.

cleanAgent.title: Clean Agent (FM-200)
cleanAgent.description: High-value, environmentally regulated agents requiring dedicated high-pressure weighing systems.

items.connect: Connect to dedicated supply. Fill to weight.
items.verify: Verify Weight (±2%). Pressure rises as it warms.

notes.noSubstitution: No substitution allowed (Must use exact agent).

componentReplacement.title: COMPONENT REPLACEMENT
componentReplacement.intro: During inspections or refilling, certain components wear out and need replacement to maintain the extinguisher's integrity and performance. Below are the standard procedures for common component replacements.

items.stuck: Gauge needle stuck or not returning to zero
items.preventive: During annual service as preventive (if old)

depressurize.title: Depressurize & Remove
depressurize.description: Follow depressurization procedures. Verify zero pressure. Unscrew gauge from valve body (wrench if needed).

select.title: Select Replacement
select.description: Must match thread size, pressure range (Powder: 0-25 bar; CO2: 0-200 bar), and mounting orientation.

install.title: Install & Test
install.description: Use new sealing washer. Hand-tighten then wrench (don't over-tighten). Repressurize and check for leaks.

proTip.title: Pro-Tip
proTip.description: Always use compatible material (Rubber, EPDM, Viton) based on agent type. Seat properly without twisting.

disassemble.title: Disassemble & Remove
disassemble.description: Disassemble valve during refill. Pry out old O-ring with a pick (don't damage groove).

clean.title: Clean & Inspect
clean.description: Remove residue from groove. Inspect for physical damage or pitting.

install.title: Install & Reassemble
install.description: Select correct size. Use light lubricant if specified. Reassemble and pressure test.

keySteps.title: Key Steps
keySteps.description:
1. Depressurize unit.
2. Match length, type (POW/CO2), and fittings.
3. Tighten securely; route without kinks.
4. Pressure test for leaks at connections.

installPin.title: Install Pin
installPin.description: Select correct size. Pin should prevent handle operation but remain removable by hand in emergency.

applySeal.title: Apply Seal
applySeal.description: Thread through pin holes. Pull tight (not too tight). Use SS+ branded seals with date.

co2Horn.title: CO2 Horn (Plastic/Metal)
co2Horn.description: Ensure secure attachment (can detach under high pressure). Designed to reduce risk of cold burns during discharge.

powderNozzle.title: Powder/Foam Nozzle
powderNozzle.description: Clean threads before installation. Match agent type and thread size. Tighten securely.

handle.title: Handle/Lever
handle.description: Replace if broken, bent, spring failure, or excessive corrosion.

techNote.title: Tech Note
techNote.description: Complex repair - requires valve disassembly. It is often more cost-effective to replace the entire valve assembly. Consult Team Leader.

whatIs.title: What is Hydrostatic Testing?
whatIs.description: A pressure test of the extinguisher cylinder to verify structural integrity, ensuring it can safely hold operating pressure without failure.

regulatory.title: Regulatory Requirement (Tunisia)
regulatory.firstTest: First Test: 10 years from manufacturing date.
regulatory.subsequent: Subsequent Tests: Every 5 years after the first test.
regulatory.mandatory: Mandatory: Must be performed by a certified testing facility.

ssRole.title: SS+ Coordination Role
ssRole.description: SS+ does NOT perform hydrostatic testing in-house as it requires specialized third-party certification. We act as the technical coordinator.

identification.title: Identification
identification.description: Check dates; if due, tag 'Hydrostatic Test Required' and remove from service.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Inform customer of cost, duration (1-2 weeks), and replacement options; get approval.

preparation.title: Preparation
preparation.description: Depressurize, empty agent, remove valve, and document serial numbers/equipment ID.

transport.title: Transport
transport.description: Deliver safely to a certified provider and obtain tracking numbers.

testing.title: Testing (3rd Party)
testing.description: 1.5x working pressure check for leaks/deformation. PASS (Stamp) or FAIL (Condemn).

retrieval.title: Retrieval
retrieval.description: Verify test stamps and certificates; inspect for any damage during transit.

reservice.title: Re-Service
reservice.description: Refill/recharge; install new seals, pin, and gauge; apply service tag with test date.

return.title: Return
return.description: Deliver with certificate; update WAVE PLUS with 5-year next due reminder.

failedTests.title: Handling Failed Hydrostatic Tests
failedTests.warning: Failed cylinders are UNLAWFUL and UNSAFE to return to service. They must be condemned.

steps.notify: Immediately Notify: Explain the safety risk to customer.
steps.replacement: Replacement: Customer must purchase new unit (SS+ or other).
steps.documentation: Documentation: Issue failure certificate and record disposal.

layer1.label: LAYER 1 (100%)
layer1.title: Technician Self-Check
layer1.description: Mandatory check of 100% of work before leaving any customer site. Focus: Service completion, work quality, and housekeeping.

layer2.label: LAYER 2 (100%)
layer2.title: Team Leader Review
layer2.description: Daily 100% audit of digital documentation in WAVE PLUS + Weekly random site visits to verify technical compliance.

layer3.label: LAYER 3 (20%)
layer3.title: Ops Responsible Audit
layer3.description: Random monthly audit of 20% of all services. Includes quality assurance calls and physical integrity inspections.

redFlags.title: Document Red Flags
redFlags.speed: Speed: Service completed suspiciously fast (rushed work?).
redFlags.consistency: Consistency: Multiple "PASS" with zero findings at aged sites (too good to be true?).
redFlags.missing: Missing Data: Missing photos, signatures, or material usage logs.
redFlags.action: Action: Immediate follow-up or return visit at SS+ cost if quality is doubted.

layer3Details.title: Layer 3: Ops Head Monthly Trend Analysis

protocols.title: Quality Assurance Protocols
protocols.qaCalls: QA Calls: 5-10 random customer calls per month to verify professionalism.
protocols.technicalAudit: Technical Audit: Detailed review of pressure/weight math in WAVE PLUS.
protocols.trendIdentification: Trend Identification: Is a specific technician always finding the same issue? Identifying training gaps.

minor.title: MINOR (Doc Errors)
minor.description: Coaching with Team Leader; corrective entry in WAVE PLUS.

moderate.title: MODERATE (Incomplete Work)
moderate.description: Mandatory return visit; formal retraining; increased supervision.

serious.title: SERIOUS (Safety Risk)
serious.description: Escalation to Gérant; disciplinary action; possible suspension of solo field duties.

completionReview.title: Completion Review
completionReview.description: Find the safety/facility manager. Present list of equipment serviced. Explain FAIL items and show physical issues. Answer all questions patiently.

signature.title: The Signature (Digital First)
signature.description: Capture digital signature on WAVE PLUS Tablet. System auto-emails a copy. Use paper as fallback (Original to client, copy to SS+ scanned within 24h).

refusal.title: If Customer Refuses to Sign
refusal.description: Do not argue. Listen to concerns and document situation.

steps.document: Document in System: Note reason (Unhappy? No authority? Policy?).
steps.evidence: Evidence: Take high-quality photos of all completed work for proof.
steps.alternative: Alternative: Request confirmation via email within 24 hours.
steps.escalate: Escalate: Inform Team Leader immediately for resolution.

whenToShoot.title: When to Shoot
whenToShoot.subtitle: Mandatory Events
whenToShoot.critical: Critical Events: All FAIL items, physical damage, safety hazards, and customer disputes.
whenToShoot.routine: Routine Proof: Samples of each extinguisher type, gauge pressure readings, and newly attached tags.

qualityChecklist.title: Quality Checklist
qualityChecklist.subtitle: Technical Standards
qualityChecklist.visualClarity: Visual Clarity: Ensure photos are in sharp focus, well-lit, and zoomed appropriately on the subject.
qualityChecklist.contextual: Contextual Evidence: Capture clear subjects showing the equipment ID and the facility location context.
qualityChecklist.reparation: Reparation Proof: Mandatory "Before vs. After" shots side-by-side for all performed repairs and part replacements.

privacy.label: Privacy
privacy.description: No people or confidential info in shots.

tagging.label: Tagging
tagging.description: Label all photos in WAVE PLUS (Unit ID).
